text: Edward Charles "Whitey" Ford (October 21, 1928Some sources, such as Retrosheet, claim a 1926 birth_date. - October 8, 2020) was a Major League Baseball pitcher who spent his entire 18-year career with the New York Yankees. He was voted into the Hall of Fame in 1974. Ford died on October 8, 2020, at his home in Lake Success, New York from dementia-related problems at the age of 91. == References == ==Other websites== Category:1928 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Deaths from dementia Category:American baseball players Category:New York Yankees players Category:Sportspeople from Queens Category:National Baseball Hall of Fame members
title: Whitey Ford
